definition: wry face/to grimace/to pull a face/comic face/face mask/devil mask
ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations
face/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]
to pull a face/to grimace/to scowl

sentences.english: She likes to make faces at the teacher.
Look! The little boy is making faces at us.
sentences.chinese: 瞧，那個小男孩在衝我們做鬼臉。

sentences.english: Had a Cowlick In Its Hair…And Didn't Pull a Face When Photographed.
sentences.chinese: 發一團糟，拍照的時候也沒有做鬼臉。

sentences.english: He made faces at the baby to make it laugh.
sentences.chinese: 他向嬰兒做鬼臉來逗他發笑。

sentences.english: You ought ton't do expressions in class.
sentences.chinese: 上課無所不能做鬼臉，出洋相。

sentences.english: The boy stole a look at his father with grimace.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩扮着鬼臉偷看了他父親一眼。

sentences.english: Then they put this"Jack-o-lantern"in their window.
sentences.chinese: 然後，他們將這“南瓜鬼臉燈”放在他們的窗臺上。

sentences.english: Benny makes a face whenever he fails a quiz.
sentences.chinese: 貝尼考試不及格就扮鬼臉。

sentences.english: Children like painting their faces at Halloween.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們喜歡在萬聖節扮鬼臉。

sentences.english: All of this led to the creation of a "mouse grimace scale".
sentences.chinese: 這一切就構成了老鼠一張活生生的“鬼臉”。

sentences.english: He often makes faces in class.
The little boy made faces at me.
sentences.chinese: 那個小傢伙衝我扮鬼臉。

sentences.english: When the curtain fell the actor was still mugging to the audience.
sentences.chinese: 幕落時，那個男演員還在向觀衆做鬼臉。

sentences.english: The most ridiculous grimaces were purposely or unconsciously indulged in.
sentences.chinese: 故意或者無心地扮出最滑稽可笑的鬼臉。

sentences.english: When she saw that her boyfriend was not happy, she made faces to amuse him.
sentences.chinese: 看到自己的男朋友不開心，她就做鬼臉逗他。

sentences.english: The schoolboy made a face at his teacher's back.
sentences.chinese: 那個男生對着教師的背後做個鬼臉。

definition: to pull a face/to grimace/to scowl
back of the head
to jump about/(of the heart) to beat wildly
bastard/scoundrel/rogue
foolishness/nonsense/foolish
to shrug one's shoulders
to make an unreasonable scene
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
clumsy/all thumbs
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
lit. to hate iron for not becoming steel/to feel resentful towards sb for failing to meet expectations and impatient to see improvement (idiom)
stammeringly
sneering/sarcasm/cynical remarks
lit. to drive a lightweight chariot on a familiar road (idiom)/fig. to do sth routinely and with ease/a walk in the park
sour face/scowling face/CL:張|张[zhang1],副[fu4]
